definition: to tattoo
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The dilemma is that not one single country within the EU is below the 3% limit, not even Germany.
sentences.chinese: 事实是包括德国在内，没有一个国家刺字低于3%。

sentences.english: Imperial courts tattooed criminals' faces before sending them into exile.
sentences.chinese: 古代刑法规定犯人流放之前要在脸上刺字，又称黥面。

definition: to tattoo the face (punishment in ancient times)
corporal punishment consisting of carving and inking characters on the victim's forehead
corporal punishment (such as castration or amputation)
to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
Yue Fei (1103-1142), Song dynasty patriot and general
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
whipping with bamboo strips (as corporal punishment)
to behead
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)

imperial five punishments of feudal China, up to Han times: tattooing characters on the forehead 墨[mo4], cutting off the nose 劓[yi4], amputation of one or both feet 刖[yue4], castration 宮|宫[gong1], execution 大辟[da4 pi4]/Han dynasty onwards: whipping 笞[chi1], beating the legs and buttocks with rough thorns 杖[zhang4], forced labor 徒[tu2], exile or banishment 流[liu2], capital punishment 死[si3]
exile (as form of punishment)
to behead
to tear off a person's four limbs and head using five horse drawn carts (as capital punishment)/to tear limb from limb
castration (archaic punishment)
public execution (old)
the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)
